thread.title: Body of filmmaker Rob Stewart is found after exhaustive search
thread.title_full: Body of filmmaker Rob Stewart is found after exhaustive search

author: David Strege
title: Body of filmmaker Rob Stewart is found after exhaustive search
text:
Body of filmmaker Rob Stewart is found after exhaustive search 
February 03, 2017 A photo posted by Rob Stewart (@teamsharkwater) on Jul 8, 2016 at 11:27am PDT 
After an exhaustive search for Toronto filmmaker Rob Stewart, who went missing after surfacing from a dive Tuesday, divers from the Key Largo Volunteer Fire Department found the body Friday about 300 feet from his last known position, the Florida Keys News reported . 
The body was found just minutes after the Coast Guard announced it was suspending the three-day search for the 37-year-old. 
Seven different Coast Guard crews, four other agencies and countless volunteers searched for the Stewart, who went missing near Alligator Reef off the Florida Keys while filming a sequel to his documentary “Sharkwater.” 
Just after 5 p.m. Tuesday, a fellow diver was picked up and promptly passed out on board after the third deep dive of the day, according to a report in the Miami Herald. When the boat went to retrieve Stewart, he was no longer in sight. Crew members believed Stewart had passed out as well and floated off. 
“He was very close to where he disappeared,” Capt. Jeffrey Janszen, commander Sector Key West, told the Florida Keys News. 
RELATED: ‘Sharkwater’ documentary filmmaker goes missing after surfacing from dive 
“Our hearts and prayers go out to Mr. Stewart’s family and friends, especially his parents Brian and Sandy, and the Canadian community during this very difficult time,” Janszen said in a statement. 
Rob’s father, Brian Stewart, said “The Coast Guard has been like family. They have been overwhelmingly supportive.” 
The Coast Guard command center coordinated 27 searches totaling more than 95 aircraft and surface hours and covering approximately 5,987 square miles, an area larger than the state of Connecticut. 
Stewart’s 2006 documentary “Sharkwater,” which examines global shark hunting and its impact on the ocean ecosystem, premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival and went on to win 40 awards at film festivals worldwide. 
He was working on “Sharkwater: Extinction.”
